summary: This is an email chain from October 6, 2021, regarding the attempted transfer of a zip file named 'DiscoveryExport_-_AF_&_ADG.zip' between individuals at the FBI New York Field Office and a US Attorney's Office in New York. The email discusses technical issues with the file being empty and suggests using USAfx for secure transfer. The subject line references 'AF & ADG' and the sender is a Special Agent from the FBI's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Desk.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: Sender of the initial email attaching a zip file named 'DiscoveryExport_-_AF_&_ADG.zip' to the US Attorney's Office; works in the FBI New York Field Office on the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Desk.

events.title: Email exchange regarding evidence transfer
events.description: Email chain discussing the attempted transfer of a discovery export zip file related to 'AF & ADG' between the FBI and the US Attorney's Office, encountering technical issues with an empty file.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated October 6, 2021, concerning the transfer of evidence related to 'AF & ADG'.
A Special Agent from the FBI's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Desk in New York attempted to send a zip file named 'DiscoveryExport_-_AF_&_ADG.zip' but it appeared empty.
The correspondence involves coordination between the FBI New York Field Office and the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS).
The email suggests using USAfx, a secure file transfer system, for sharing the evidence.
The subject matter is linked to the FBI's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Desk, indicating the content likely pertains to investigations in that area.
